pages.title: Overview
pages.content:
Anara offers several ways to add content to your library.
​Upload menu
You can upload files or entire folders by clicking the + icon at the top of the left sidebar.
​Drag and drop
If you prefer drag and drop, you can drop files into the main library table, into a specific folder’s table, or directly onto a folder in the left sidebar.
​Via URL or ID
You can also bring content in using the in-app import tools. Select Import → URL from the + menu to add websites, PDFs, or YouTube videos by pasting a link. For research papers, use Import → ID to import directly by DOI, PMID, or arXiv ID.
​URL prefix
If you already have the link open in your browser, you can use the URL prefix method. Simply type anara.com/ before any YouTube, website, or document URL in your browser’s address bar and press Enter—just make sure you’re logged in to Anara first.
​Chrome extension
Finally, you can install our Web Clipper Chrome extension to save content while browsing the web. It lets you import files, folders, and web pages directly to your library in a single click. See the Chrome extension guide.

pages.title: Supported file types for import
pages.content:
Anara supports importing all major document, image, video, and audio file types.

Documents: pdf, doc, docx, epub, ppt, pptx, md, txt
Websites: url
Images: jpg, jpeg, png, tiff, bmp, heic
Videos: mp4, YouTube url
Audio: mp3, wav

Something missing from this list? Reach out with a suggestion.
We automatically apply OCR to supported image-based documents, including poorly formatted and handwritten documents, so their text is searchable. See OCR support for details.

pages.title: OCR support
pages.content:
Our system can automatically extract text from scanned documents and images using Optical Character Recognition (OCR). This allows you to search, highlight, and work with text that would otherwise be locked inside image-based files.
The OCR process is applied automatically to all imported content containing image-based text, with no manual activation required.
​How it works
When you upload a supported file type containing image-based text, Anara runs OCR in the background. Once processed, the extracted text is stored alongside the file so it can be included in full-text search results, highlighted and copied, and used in Anara’s summarization and analysis tools
​Supported formats
Our OCR feature supports a wide range of document types:

PDFs with scanned pages or image content
All image files (jpg, jpeg, png, tiff, bmp, heic)
Screenshots and images embedded within documents
Handwritten notes (with support for multiple languages)
